placeDetails.name: Walker Hotel Tribeca
contactDetails: ÓÉà77 Walker St, New York, NY 10013

reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed in a lot of hotels in Manhattan and wouldn‚Äôt return here. The location is great and the Blue Bottle in the lobby was lovely to have. Check in was a mess, service throughout our stay was not great, and room keys ‚Ä¶

Location was fine and the room was clean. Service at the front desk was extraordinarily, above-and-beyond helpful, with everything from AC to check-in. However, the rooms are so small that they're barely habitable‚Äîthe bed was so small that ‚Ä¶

I could not have asked for a better experience at this hotel! From the moment we walked in, the staff was friendly and helpful. We were upgraded to a king suite and received free drink vouchers. While we were only staying one night, we got ‚Ä¶

Great location and staff are very helpful. The room was mostly clean but some corners had dust buildup and/or weren‚Äôt wiped properly. Some parts of the room a bit tired and in need of TLC. Rooms are very small - but that‚Äôs manhattan for ‚Ä¶

The staff here are incredibly friendly and go out of their way to make sure you feel welcome! It was our first time here, and our room was upgraded and the manager gave us two free drinks as well. The rooms were exactly as pictured and very clean. Perfect for two people. Location was great as well. Would definitely stay here again!

Pros:
- Great location!
- Rooms are clean and nice feeling. ‚Ä¶

Came here for a one night stay and it was such a lovely experience. Bridgette and all the other staff members we engaged with were so nice. The location is in great spot and you have two bars, a restaurant, and two coffee/pastries options ‚Ä¶

Stay at the hotel last week and the service was excellent. Shauna at the front the desk was super helpful and very welcoming. The rooms were great too, wish they were a tad bit bigger but definitely fine for my length of stay. Would highly recommend this place.

Stayed here for a long weekend with a friend. It was a lovely hotel with character and charm. Loved the on-site restaurant, coffee shop, lounge and rooftop. Staff were always friendly. Good location. Would definitely recommend.
Really friendly staff everyone, great coffee and breakfast. Unique experience in their underground bar. Nice room. Good gym. Would come again! ü•∞ ‚Ä¶

I‚Äôve stayed here many times over the years and I love it. Perfect location for my interests, comfy rooms, and great staff. In particular, Nelson is always ready to help with my bags, storing items before and after checkout, and offering ‚Ä¶

I was impressed with the check-in with their friendly but professional personality. They explained how use your room car to use to go up to your or roof top. They gave a map of  how locate the numerous art galleries nearby The check -in staff told of what services were available.

Location and service were fine. Room was awful. It was insanely small, but that was expected. No fridge, our safe was broken so we couldn‚Äôt even use that, and we couldn‚Äôt sleep at night because it sounded like the window was open (even ‚Ä¶

Great location. On check in, my door lock was broken and couldn‚Äôt close my door. I asked for someone to come fix it and nobody showed up within 1 hour so I tampered with the door and closed it myself. I was only visiting nyc for 2 days so I ‚Ä¶

I stayed here in May 2024 and I can say I will not stay here again or recommend it to friends. The rooms are tiny, even by NYC standards, the layout of the hotel is odd, no ramp for luggage, front desk down a set of stairs, small dark ‚Ä¶

Went here for a solo trip into NYC for MDW. Honestly the best spot and reasonable for being in Tribeca. You are just minutes away from Chinatown and Little Italy not to mention the Brooklyn Bridge. Tons of great restaurants and the ‚Ä¶

I'm going to give you the good and the bad.
There are a lot of good things about the Walker Tribeca, which you will see in the pictures. The bad things, though, while few, are enough of a deal breaker ‚Ä¶

No ramp for luggage and no one helps you get up to the front desk which I thought was odd. There are a number of steps to get inside and then you have to go downstairs to check in. The elevator and hallways are small and narrow but the ‚Ä¶

Both elevators were down, the whole hotel had to use the staff elevator. Incredibly slow
No coffee maker inside rooms. The ‚Äúdo not disturb‚Äù light didn‚Äôt work, so was ‚Ä¶
I recently stayed at the Walker Hotel in Tribeca and was disappointed by my experience. Despite the hotel's charming decor and convenient location, several issues significantly marred our stay. ‚Ä¶

I visit the city on a monthly basis and this is the ONLY place I would ever stay in NYC. It is honestly a second home for me. From beginning to end, the Walker Tribeca offers you a flawless stay. Perfect location. Best area. The bars and ‚Ä¶
Room 219 is extremely noisy --- DO NOT STAY. If you stay, make sure you stay on a higher floor and/or not on the same corner as 219. ‚Ä¶

My daughter and I had a great time at the Walker. Yes, rooms are small but that is what is expected in TriBeCa/soho and from a fun boutique hotel.  We booked through NYU and thought we were getting a deal but looks like we overpaid a bit-my only regret there but we had a great stay and love the space.

Very beautiful hotel, except the size of the room my wife and I rented for just a few hours was very small and very expensive for us, charged us $354.00.They didn't offer a bereavement fare nor a complimentary breakfast. None of our money back when we checked in around 4 AM Wed morning and checked out before the 10 AM check out time..
We are very happy to have booked this hotel. It has a convenient location near the Canal St. Metro station and SoHo. Lots of different breakfast, lunch and dinner options within walking distance. ‚Ä¶

The Walker Hotel Tribeca is a hidden gem in the heart of New York City, offering an unparalleled boutique experience. From the moment you step into the stylish lobby, you're greeted by a warm and welcoming ambiance that perfectly blends ‚Ä¶

I was traveling with family and friends, and coordinated the group to stay at the hotel, with three reservations. The night prior to arriving in NYC, I called to see if we could have access to one room to drop our luggage and freshen up ‚Ä¶

The rooms are so absurdly tiny it‚Äôs kinda funny. Especially for the price. King bed is up against three walls so you can only access it from one side. Terrible sound proofing from the street and inside. You can easily hear other people‚Äôs ‚Ä¶

What a great location for a hotel! Would highly recommend to friends and family visiting from out of town or even just for a staycation. Cozy, functional room with incredible views and access to top-notch food and activities. The staff were ‚Ä¶

I checked in and have been asked for a caution of 500 USD (to be frozen on the credit card) to cover eventual damage, or for expenditure I will have like drinks. As I checked out, they told me I have around 70 USD costs for some stuff I ‚Ä¶
rooms are small for NY and poorly maintained. hotel is not actually in tribeca. there are so many better hotels, I don't know why anyone would ever willingly stay here

Pros: The rooms are well designed with a comfortable bed and nice sheets. Shower is great and the auto blinds are clutch. The location is also really great and I love how there‚Äôs a coffee shop downstairs. ‚Ä¶

The room was the size of a closet, no space to put anything or even walk. Extremely cramped. Only had access to the bed from one side. The view is of another building across the street. The location was more of Chinatown than TriBeCa. It‚Äôs ‚Ä¶

I was invited here on a sex date. The rooms are small but smart; the closeness of the walls and furniture provide lots of sturdy push-off points for different positions and angles. Staff made me feel welcome and unashamed as I left early. ‚Ä¶

Staff is amazing it‚Äôs always a pleasure staying here they definitely go above and beyond to accommodate you best staff ever  I also love how clean the rooms are would recommend this hotel to everyone

we booked the trip far in advance and paid all needed fees when we arrived they placed a $400 hold on our credit card for ‚Äúincidentals‚Äù. after we left we were charged $107 for wifi(on the website it said free), water, gym, and 20% off the ‚Ä¶

Last minute booking for one night - staff was all very helpful, especially Nelson. Kind and willing to help out. I requested a couple things for the room and the service was quick and got what we needed right away.  The room is small but I ‚Ä¶

Had an amazing time at the Walker Tribeca. The location was incredible and in the heart of everything we wanted to do. The staff were responsive, kind and helpful. Our room had the most beautiful view of the entire downtown. We loved the ‚Ä¶

This hotel needs a serious tune up- both in service as well as condition of the rooms.
There is no real lobby - the entrance leads to a restaurant check in and a ‚Ä¶

i was staying there for  1 night the reception are so helpful the room are nice small but modern design i like it. the bed is agains the wall no more space not really affordable for the kind of room and there wifi soooo bad i ddnt connect ‚Ä¶

I‚Äôm giving 4 stars because the room was so tiny it didn‚Äôt make me mad but rather laugh. Staff is great and there is an amazing speakeasy. Bed was comfortable. Be aware that my partner and I couldn‚Äôt both leisurely hang AT ALL in the room, ‚Ä¶

The hotel is between Soho and Tribeca, near the Canal subway station. Edwin and Nelson at the front desk are outstanding in being efficient, friendly, helpful, and polite; they speak English and Spanish. The rooms are according to the ‚Ä¶
Nice hotel in a great location - downtown Manhattan. They serve the best coffee in the coffee shop in the lobby. I recommend.
It was perfect! Big thanks to Nelson from the hotel staff, he was really helpful.

Smallest hotel room I‚Äôve ever experienced. Surprise ‚Äúfacilities fee‚Äù gets charged without any warning - $35 per day. Wish we booked somewhere else for the price it ended up coming to. Don‚Äôt be fooled by the nice photos. It‚Äôs claustrophobic and better off looking elsewhere
the room was tiny, had no coffee station! but the location and the service were amazing... check the bars at the hotel and they are awesome...

I Really don‚Äôt know where to start should I start off with the guest service from host who didn‚Äôt acknowledge us not even once then when ask a question about parking or anything else around there no answer but that‚Äôs not my concern my main ‚Ä¶

the photos online are cute and charming, but the rooms themselves are comically small, claustrophobic, and poorly designed. especially for the price, i was surprised to see an entire shelf missing under the bed, veneer peeling, holes in the ‚Ä¶

This review is for Nelson, the nicest porter who helped me get my super heavy bags down a few stairs and into my uber. Uber driver didn‚Äôt lift a finger so Nelson helped me hoist the bags in the trunk. Very knightly and kind of him!

For half the price of a normal NYC room you get what you pay for, 1/3 of a room. I ended up in one of their smaller rooms basically a walk in closet, it didn‚Äôt even have a chair. The open space in the room was 5 x 5 foot, standing room ‚Ä¶

The hotel is at a good location, we could walk to almost everywhere, and the subway station is also very close.
The room is small, but very cozy, comfortable and clean. We had a room on the ‚Ä¶

Smallest room i ever had, but acceptable. I am under 5'6" and was just able to fit for the bed which was very restful and comfortable. Great location between Chinatown and Little Italy. Room was clean, shower good. Raised toilet. I was not aware of add on daily charge around 35.

Room was absurdly small, must be hard for housekeeping. Front desk offered no help in getting a taxi, we had Three suitcases and a large artwork portfolio. We dragged them out to curb while I went two blocks to retrieve a taxi. Front desk ‚Ä¶

Was part of the Bernadette Thompson nail team for another Fashion show during Fashion week on September 7, 2024. The work area was small to do nails, but everyone was professional and was about getting the job done.
Overall very comfortable hotel in a great location with some downsides. Few things to keep in mind before you book: ‚Ä¶

Great location & lovely hotel however, we found the corner room noisy. Baring in the mind it‚Äôs NYC, there is traffic (we get it) however there appears to be little sound proofing in the windows (compared to another hotel we stayed at in ‚Ä¶

The rooms are on the smaller side but I enjoy a queen size bed and still felt like I had room to walk back and forth to the restroom. The view and location is what I enjoyed most. Plenty of places to walk to for coffee and it‚Äôs so ‚Ä¶
This was a great stay. We walked in and wend down the stairs where I felt as if I was entering a speak-easy. It was not but the beautiful wood work in the ceiling was cool. ‚Ä¶

Location:
Perfect location for getting around the city. I spent a lot of time in Tribeca which ended up being my favorite part. The hotel is also on a low traffic street ‚Ä¶

This place is always very clean with friendly staff! We arrived early and not only did the receptionist accommodate us on a really busy graduation weekend, they gave us a handicap accessible room without us asking because they noticed my ‚Ä¶

The room was compact for a king but well designed - staying on my own for three nights I found it secure, comfortable and clean. I booked directly via the hotel website which offered breakfast and 2pm checkout as part of the room rate. The ‚Ä¶
The rooftop bar is great. Greg views. Heated alcoves.

Awesome hotel! The AC was working perfectly, it was a really hot weekend. The room is small but perfectly set up. The lights are great and everything was clean. Staff was really helpful and nice. The lobby is shared with a really nice ‚Ä¶

i stayed here last week and was incredibly taken aback by how rude the manager Mia was. she greeted me with the nastiest look when i walked in tuesday morning and asked what her problem was and she had the nastiest reply back of just ‚Äúnothing‚Äù and kept walking with her nasty grin right to her office.
We stayed here for 4 nights during a short trip to NYC. Absolutely amazing staff, every single person we came across was so nice, couldn‚Äôt have felt more welcome, looked after and comfortable! ‚Ä¶

My recent stay with the Walker Hotel Tribeca was less than desirable. Although the staff did their best to accommodate, this was an uncomfortable experience that only allowed so much for rest. I first had to switch rooms due to features ‚Ä¶
I would not book this hotel again. Rooms like shoeboxes, limited service. Location is okay but canal street is not the nicest area in my opinion.

This place was very fun and great spot in New York! Great prices for New York for a clean and modern place. It‚Äôs pretty much a high end hostel (especially if you get the smallest room). The room is super small but has everything you need. ‚Ä¶

I stayed here on a short trip I took in February and I could not recommend this place more. The staff was amazing and provided such great service. They were also all super friendly and willing to help. I also loved the convenience of being ‚Ä¶

I love visiting lower Manhattan and staying in TriBeCa. This small hotel was a great place to stay and enjoy a night in the heart of it all. Located on a quiet side street, I enjoyed the views of Broadway and Walker Street. The lobby and ‚Ä¶
The location of the hotel is perfect. Nearby are buses and metro. Many galleries. ‚Ä¶

The regular rooms are comically small.
The employees were great.
The wifi is useless. ‚Ä¶
We have stayed at hundred if not thousands of hotels all over the world and the staff at this one are THE best.  They are exceptionally helpful, warm, friendly and caring. ‚Ä¶

Sorry New York, we are from LA and we have a lot of space, your micro rooms where the beds literally touch 3 walls freaks me out. You almost bump your face on the back wall as you come in the door. I thought I stepped into another elevator. ‚Ä¶
I prepaid my room but got double charged. It‚Äôs been a whole week still haven‚Äôt received any response.

So friendly, helpful, professional, warm staff. Very accommodating. Up to date room, sink in room, king bed, spacious modern shower/toilet. Cafe service, beautiful rooftop another club. All secure with W card needed to access areas. Felt ‚Ä¶

What a special place- I brought some of my grad students this morning for a coffee and the woman at the front desk made sure we were cared for with coffee and water even though the cafe wasn‚Äôt open when we arrived. Her true hospitality took ‚Ä¶

I stayed here just for one night, traveling for work. This is one of the cutest hotels I have ever stayed at! The rooms are small but I didn‚Äôt mind it since I was traveling alone. The view from my room was incredible. The coffee shop ‚Ä¶
Nice hotel. Room was small but adequate. Hotel employees were very nice.

This hotel is a gem in Tribeca. We booked a large room but I believe the regular rooms are pretty NY standard (#iykyk). Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was clean and stylish. There‚Äôs a cafe, coffee shop, restaurant and speak easy all ‚Ä¶
Room 705 has no blackout curtains. The light will wake you up when the sunrises. Forget trying to sleep in. Not happy.

We booked a stay for a long holiday weekend on Manhattan and had a really great experience! The rooms are no smaller than we were expecting, and they were cozy and sleek. The bar was really really fun, and the coffee shop on site is ‚Ä¶

Great hotel in the heart of Tribeca, easy walk to Soho etc. Fantastic staff, special shout out to Mercedes who was a ray of light after a tough journey, made our check-in process smooth and we felt instantly welcome. ‚Ä¶

Avoid at all costs! Birthday ruined. Visited end of May - June.

Firstly, the rooms are tiny even for New York. Its a struggle to fit two people ‚Ä¶

I was shocked that the rich like this kind of abuse and degradation. We came here as an after party for an art fair. I told the very nice front desk person that the closest I'd ever been to the hotel is to use the bathroom at Blue Bottle in ‚Ä¶

Location was great. Rooms are extremely small. You get a bed, a closet, a sink, and a bathroom. For those of you traveling with a companion, the bathroom door loosely slides closed and doesn‚Äôt latch. There is no fan. You can hear EVERYTHING ‚Ä¶

Every aspect of our stay at this hotel was amazing. The staff was above and beyond accommodating. From making sure we had a room with a view, to great recommendations from the bellman, to the kindness of the housekeeping staff - it was all ‚Ä¶

I stayed here for a week and it was a great place for a business trip to NYC. Wi-Fi is strong, there‚Äôs a Blue Bottle coffee in the same building (with lots of couches for doing work on), a nice bar at the connected restaurant, and the ‚Ä¶

Walker Hotel Tribeca was the perfect home for my 5 day trip to NYC. The room is very chic, and super clean with all amenities & more. The staff is super friendly and always available to help. They have a coffee shop & lunch/dinner spot in ‚Ä¶

The Walker Hotel is beautifully designed and furnished, affordble, and every single staff member I met were super friendly and helpful. I stayed for work - there's a great space to work and hang out in the lobby. The Blue Bottle cafe was a ‚Ä¶

I loved the location amenities the room was small but large bed and big tv. They have a nice coffee shop on the first floor so that was convenient.  The shower spout was in the ceiling. Plenty of hot water. Best shower ever. Very clean. ‚Ä¶
If you want somewhere to just relax kick up it's cool

Located near SoHo, Chinatown, and Little Italy. Also a short walk (less than 5 min) to Canal St. Subway Station!
Comfortable bed, luxurious bath products, and even a rainfall shower head! Room ‚Ä¶

Some of their staff - Alicia/Alyssa and Met - are not great quality. The rest have been great, but I won‚Äôt be visiting again after dealing with those two. I was a fan and gave this place five stars after my first stay, not this time. This ‚Ä¶

I had an opportunity to have an evening to myself, away from my husband and daughter, to recharge.  I picked this hotel to get away and it was perfect for the moment.  Visitors should be warned that the rooms are very small with showers ‚Ä¶

Front desk any time I stay or call seems overwhelmed. They get flustered when balancing both calls and check in. Johnathen couldn‚Äôt get my email correct after 3 attempts, then asking me to take down their email instead, basically passing me ‚Ä¶

The room is clean, comfortable and gorgeous. However, the back office and customer service was rude and horrible. Called to ask why was the room half made or unmade ok different days and half drank water bottles (not ours) was left in our ‚Ä¶

I‚Äôm currently staying in Walker Hotel Tribeca, the hotel has such a cool vibe and great atmosphere in the cafe downstairs!! But I came in here just to say how wonderful and helpful the staff is! JOSEF the manager has been super helpful and ‚Ä¶

Decent, clean comfy bed, small rooms.
Staff ranges from ok to clueless. One staff woman at the checkout kept calling me ‚Äúsweetie‚Äù‚Ä¶ a little too familiar. Another had no idea who was in charge of ‚Ä¶

It was my first time visiting New York and I stumbled upon this beautiful boutique hotel online. I stayed here for 4 nights and it was the best decision I made. Disregard the comments about the size of the room. The room is a cozy size, ‚Ä¶

We stayed there for two days of New York City weekend fun. We booked trips to jazz clubs/restaurants/plays. It was a great location.
We got a standard room which was very small but normal for New York City. ‚Ä¶

First time staying and was very impressed. Staff was extremely friendly! I booked with Bell a few hours before arriving and she was absolutely lovely. The space is very well decorated and awesome vibes. Very clean facility rooms are smaller but what more do you need! You won‚Äôt spend much time in the room anyways!

We arrived at the Walker Hotel for the weekend and the check-in was extremely uncomfortable. Once given the key to our room, we opened the door to find an unclean room with towels stacked on the bathroom floor, a dirty shower, no soap, a ‚Ä¶

This hotel blew me away! I travel constantly for work and am usually Marriott loyal but this experience made me rethink that. This hotel is perfectly thoughtful to the modern traveler.  It open community area is the ideal environment for ‚Ä¶
Great customer service and really friendly staff. Room is compact but clean and bathroom is neat and nice. Bed is comfortable. ‚Ä¶

This has become my go to NYC hotel. I absolutely love it. The rooms are sleek, modern, and NY cozy. The staff is incredible. Every time I stay, they are so welcoming, friendly, and helpful with anything! The lobby and other public spaces ‚Ä¶

I have stayed at this hotel once before and it was a very pleasant experience. Today I wanted to give a special shout out to Edgar, who was fantastically helpful the other day as I was planning my next stay at the property. He answered the ‚Ä¶

I booked this trip for work due to proximity, and I loved it. I looked at a lot of reviews and honestly, was not super sure due to various good and below average reviews, but I only had the best experience with the staff, room, cleanliness, ‚Ä¶

The lowest-priced rooms are tiny but well-appointed. The staff is awesome. There is a dude at the front named Jay that helped me out a bunch while I was there this week with directions, getting a table to work at, finding my bags, ‚Ä¶
Amazing hotel - friendly and professional staff; clean and modern rooms; great vibe throughout the facility. A tremendous value for NYC, and the location can't be beat. Just awesome!

Nice little boutique hotel. The rooms are a little small but nicely updated and clean. The coffee shop on the main floor is clutch for early mornings. They also have a rooftop bar which has an incredible view that I cannot recommend enough. Nice location centrally located. I stay here every time I'm in New York

Absolutely loved this hotel! Great location, conveniently located around train stations. Hotel staff was great, Eric was great and very accommodating. Hotel and rooms overall are pretty clean and beds are comfortable, the rooms are small ‚Ä¶
Walker hotel is a millennial's dream spot in NYC. The location is great, the hotel is cute and modern and just sexy enough. Staff is accommodating and polite. ‚Ä¶

Well decorated and ideally located to explore NYC. But for the rest not a good experience. We knew the room was small but not that small. You can't even go around the bed. But the worst part was the noise, we could hear everything going on ‚Ä¶

Room is small, but we were out all day and only used it to sleep so it was perfect and everything we needed. The room is nice and fancy. My dog loved the king bed. The staff was not a bother and very accommodating. The hotel is very clean ‚Ä¶

Me and my boyfriend stayed there during Christmas holidays. You can see warm
sunset on the whole New York from the window! The hotel is really clean and smells good. Really photogenic too so I took some pics for my insta. The location is really nice. We were just walking to some places from the hotel. Recommend it to stay in New York!
Rooms are on the smaller side but service is always friendly and is very convenient to get around nyc from here
Nice, hip place! Clean with a very interesting gym. I've never used a fast manual treadmill before so it was nice that I was given the chance to try something new.
No good experience. Many broken things at room: safe, store behind the bed, light key‚Ä¶. ‚Ä¶

I'd love the location, not a busy street but still very convenient as close to Soho, chinatown, metro station
Doesn't offer breakfast all the time but the lobby is comfy plus a nice underground jazz bar  and a very nice rooftop !enjoy !

Pretty subpar experience at this hotel - seemed to be not well kept and lacked basic essentials (i.e robes). Further the heat was not working, and wasn't fixed for the duration of our stay despite asking. A baseboard heater was sent but would have preferred the AC system to actually work - the technician didn't even try.

Met all my expectations. As a solo traveller the King room was more than enough space. Super comfortable bed, great shower, and nice central location. Would definitely stay again and recommend to friends.

Room is tiny but the bed was super comfortable with a really high quality mattress. The reason for 4 starts is that the window is hardly doing anything in the way of noise filtering making the night very noisy. Every street conversation and ‚Ä¶

Amazing customer service - from the moment of a friendly staff opening the door for you, to the most graceful, elegant and welcoming front desk manager Edgar (who deserves a separate 5 start review!!) to the cleaning team and the most ‚Ä¶
This was such an amazing stay and highly recommended! We will be back for sure

The hotel was amazing! The room was super cute, pod style. Lobby, restaurant and cafe were awesome. The staff could‚Äôve been nicer though‚Ä¶ I was there for an engagement and they didn‚Äôt seem to care or was welcoming. The Bartender was super super nice tho! Overall, great place, I will recommend!

Seamless check in and out. Service was outstanding from beginning to end. Loved the industrial/art deco design. Room finishings were of high quality. Lobby/ coffee lounge area was so peaceful to hang about. Definitely will stay again!

Nice decor in rooms. Perfect for 1/2 night stay but limited storage/wardrobe space for longer& could be slightly cleaner. No restaurant /bar facilities in the evening but presumably covid 19 is mostly to blame. Presumably the atmosphere in the hotel would otherwise be more vibrant.

Just overall weird vibes for the amount of money you pay. People walking in and out all the time with no security. Lobby is located downstairs. Was trying to work in the lobby (which was very dirty) and they tried to send me to my room. Rooms are very cramped for the high price point.

It was an okay experience. The receptionist who greeted and assisted us during the stay was so friendly.
It's my first time booking a hotel during the pandemic so maybe I'm just not ‚Ä¶

So be careful when booking, we ended up booking at the wrong Walker hotel. This spot was not terrible as an overall experience but the room was really small. Our room had a queen bed facing a single large window and next to it was 3 feet to ‚Ä¶

This hotel is fantastic. The design is thoughtful and very nice. The rooms are small. You can even see a floorplan of the rooms on the website. This didn't bother me at all but I want to mention it because it's part of the charm. The rooms ‚Ä¶

Cute little place in a great location!
Room was very small even for one person.
No coffee in room but you can buy one at the cafe located on site. ‚Ä¶

In the middle of lower Manhattan close to everything 12-15 minutes! Close to Chinatown and little Italy...many restaurants to enjoy! In the morning lovely coffee shop and pastries to enjoy and in the evening a beautiful roof top bar to relax and enjoy too!

Super pleased with my stay. I was here for 3 nights in May 2022. The room was immaculate and the bed super comfy. Huge windows with tons of light. Marble bath with rainhead shower. Lavender peppermint bath goodies. Great coffee shop in ‚Ä¶

Don‚Äôs usually post reviews, but feel compelled in this situation. Short trip to NY to visit family @Little Italy. Read review and ratings and chose the Walker. Clean place, but significant issues leading to a very poor experience. Room was ‚Ä¶
Rooms were great. All of the guys were super tentative! It has a great location, with two coffee shops in the first floor.

The decor, details, the staff and the vibe everything about this hotel lobby and caf√©. It's  the subtle elegance that keeps me coming back and just lounge with a drink and smile. The staff is always welcoming and friendly, no matter who you are. It¬¥s clean and just feels right.

Very comfortable bed and I couldn't hear any of my neighbors. These are really the two most important parts of any hotel. Definitely wish there was less hair all over the bed when we checked in but overall we had a good experience.

If you end up being locked out of 405 broadway overnight or not electricity or hot water. This hotel is the best. Cheap and cool place to chill. While you wait to figure out what to do with your life. Also a great meeting spot!

Overall had a great stay! Location was perfect with great access to the subway and ease to get around SoHo, Chinatown and lower Manhattan + Brooklyn. The hotel itself was very nice & trendy as were the rooms. ‚Ä¶
Flower shop roof top bar is amazing

My go-to hotel in NYC. Super nice staff. Comfy bed. Well-designed and aesthetically pleasing. Good water pressure and toiletries. Lobby coffee, nice chairs, and occasional music are nice touches as well!

Love hate relationship. Loved how the room was so up to date. Hated how tiny the room was - but for one day only it was good. The pillows weren‚Äôt great. The bed was good. I paid a high price for a tiny room, but hope to try a larger room at a more reasonable price. Pillows need an upgrade though.

I stayed at the Walker Tribeca late last year. I liked the hotel lobby and coffee shop. It was nicely decorated with plants. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was small, but that isn't uncommon in NY. The room was clean and the ‚Ä¶
Walker Hotel Tribecca is beautifully designed (as an Interior Designer myself) and I really appreciate those details. ‚Ä¶

Great coffee shop in the lobby.
The pistachio croissant is really world class.
They put a lot of effort into making every food they serve the most excellent in a very casual environment but still elegant and cool

EXCELLENT SERVICE
My boyfriend and I stayed there for 17 days!! We had a very easy, welcoming and fast Check-In, done by Zach. The hotel is well located, its so close to Canal ‚Ä¶

Had a great stay here! Rooms are small but cool vibe and cozy. The rooftop, speakeasy and coffee shop are a great addition. Thank you to the team for helping with my accommodations and Nelson was super helpful!

Weird location, felt closer to Chinatown then Tribeca. Rooms were extremely small. Online pictures made them look bigger, got the King Comfort room and thought that would be much larger than a 150sqft room
Very nice but very tiny room; I am not sure if all of the rooms are this small so beware before brining kids.  This would be great for a couples getaway; very intimate and inviting hotel.

This hotel has one fabulous location. It is brand new and quite terrific. I love the lobby with its super cool vibe. The rooms as everyone has said are super small but hey it is NYC after all. I found mine really clean and love being on the ‚Ä¶

Worse experience ever.  I am a New Yorker and have to say my stay here was awful. A fight broke out on the corner of the Walker Hotel amongst a crowd of 30 to 40 people around 3 am. My husband and I asked the concierge to contact the Police ‚Ä¶

I've never stayed at the Walker but have gotten drinks here and frequently do work on my computer in their lobby on the weekends.  I love this place.  The docor is extremely pretty and the couches / lounge area is very comfotable.  The best ‚Ä¶

It‚Äôs fine. It‚Äôs more in Chinatown than in Tribeca itself. The intersection on the way from SoHo/Midtown can be a little creepy. Rooms are very tiny, so I do not recommend this place if you‚Äôre staying for more than 3 nights. ‚Ä¶

I had an amazing stay in this hotel. From the check-in to check-out and during my stay the service was tremendous. The hotel is just opened, so there are a few renovations going on but that didn't effect the pleasure I had, since staff did ‚Ä¶

Location is great. So is ambiance.
Service is poor, bordering on arrogant.
Replenishments (water bottles, towels, toiletries) are stingy. ‚Ä¶
Check in was quick - staff attentive and friendly.  Room was compact but clean and well laid out.  Much better than my other experiences with Manhattan hotels

I arrived late in the evening on a Monday night.  The lobby was quiet, except for two gentlemen doing some light painting as they're still touching the place up after opening not too long ago.  Check-in is on the very bottom floor.  This ‚Ä¶

This place is sensational! We stayed in a beautiful room on the 9th floor waking up to a splendid and slightly different view each morning. The shower was absolutely magical (we spent quite some time analysing why; we agreed it was a ‚Ä¶

Our stay was incredible! So clean, beautiful, and kind staff.  The view is incredible and amenities are top notch.  The bed is the comfiest I‚Äôve had from a hotel. Wouldn‚Äôt change a thing!  If you‚Äôre considering it, stay here! You won‚Äôt regret it. This is the only place I‚Äôll be staying from now on!

Very pretty rooftop at this moment, with all the flowers! It gives a good view of the skyline, and it has rather fairly priced glasses of wine / beer to refresh!

The lobby security person is very inappropriate. While leaving one of the restrooms and heading up stairs I heard them say ‚ÄúHe must of blown that up‚Äù referring to the amount of time I spent in the restroom. What a disgusting and ‚Ä¶
Perfect experience staying in New York! Will definitely come back again! Gym is most of the time empty although it's slightly tiny. The lobby is beautiful!

Staff was excellent! Rooms clean, small but served the purpose. Enjoyed the modern technology like lights/shade controls and casting home service on TV. Great water pressure in shower and plenty of hot water. Bed very comfortable and ‚Ä¶

Really friendly service and a chic property. We liked our room, and were barely in the room at all, but be aware that some of the rooms are very small. They make amazing use of the space, but it's tight!

5 stars- I highly recommend the Walker Hotel in Tribeca. This is a beautiful hotel and the rooms are really nice as well as comfortable. It's a very high-end boutique hotel which feels like a home away from home. Awesome location right on ‚Ä¶

Moved rooms twice with no A/C in either. Checked in here with high hopes but didn‚Äôt stay longer than about 3 hours. The A/C in the first room wasn‚Äôt working when I checked in - no big deal I just called down to ask for someone to take a ‚Ä¶

Superb service, especially from the two doormen/bell boys. Room was small but space was clean and incredibly efficiently used - there was space to store everything out of the way for two. Bathroom was very comfortable. What more can you ask for?
Its Christmas Eve. All flights were cancelled about an hour ago. Now not only am I not able to be with my mom, I am out $400. The Walker pocketed the whole fee and refuses to rebook. ‚Ä¶

Good:

The hotel was brand new (opened Sep 2019) - electronic curtains, USB by the bed. ‚Ä¶
Rooms are basically coffins but quiet so if u want to just sleep in a coffin to have a great night's sleep, it's awesome

The King room is super comfortable and well designed. This is the PERFECT hotel if you are looking to AVOID CATCHING COVID. The rooms have HUGE windows that open and it is NOT CENTRAL AIR. Each room's heat/AC is on a closed circuit meaning ‚Ä¶

I had the most amazing stay here during COVID. I was in town for work for just one night. Francis at the front desk couldn't have been any nicer or helpful when I asked him for food delivery options. The lobby is beautiful, and my room was amazing too. I hope I'll have to go back again soon :)
Great convenient location near all transportation. has a lovely lobby where you can work and also a great rooftop bar as well as a speakeasy in the side street in Courtland Alley. highly recommend

As a huge fan of boutique hotels I approve this one. Very charming, attention to detail, comfortable with an ideal location in between Tribeca and Chinatown. We had a lovely stay and we will be back for sure!
Joshua Bellmen went above and beyond to assist today. Greatly appreciate his professionalism and help.

Hotel was fine with a nice coffee shop downstairs. However reception and back office staff are rude and incapable. They completely messed up the charges of our group, overcharged my card (by about 5k!) and caused me hours of work to sort this out. Won't chose them again.

Quaint hotel in the heart of tribeca. Rooms are  small, but functional and cozy. The bar and coffee shop downstairs are very convenient for late nights or early mornings. Location is excellent, close proximity to China town, little italy, ‚Ä¶

The room is basically the bed. Wall-to-wall-to-window the bed is directly attached on three sides to the three walls of the room.  The bed takes up 95% of the room.  You walk into the bed - it is one step from the door.  You living space is ‚Ä¶

The room was barely big enough for two people to stand up. Small even by new York standards. No AC all night long, so it was sweltering and sticky. The staff was friendly the bed sheets clean, and we had hot water. The pillow was thin and lumpy. We will never go back.

Walker Hotel Tribeca is an excellent hotel with amazing service. Steven at the reception desk was kind enough to print package label and help me navigate my stay. I even extend my stay an extra night. Beautiful kind room with sleek and ‚Ä¶

We arrived at midnight and receptionist gave us the smallest room, which is clearly on the map on the door. Also I am pretty sure this room is for one person since the bed is in full size and only one robe in the closet, which makes me ‚Ä¶
We upgraded our room and the bed still touched three of the four walls. Incredibly tiny NY rooms. I question if this is in Tribeca, as it is in the heart of Chinatown. ‚Ä¶

The hotel and the location are fine! Nothing amazing but for the price is perfect. The real reason this experience was bad is because of the service. It is terrible. Very disappointed with the front desk and in general just everyone seemed ‚Ä¶

It was cozy and cute stay. The wifi and technology was a hit and a miss in the room. The staff were kind. There was room damage as well. It didn't significantly hinder the trip but I would sink in to the hole in the ground every so often when I went to the restroom.

Very good hotel, well located between Tribeca and the Soho. Rooms are small, but is something recurrent in Manhattan. We managed to walk almost all our way into NYC. The treatment by the staff is great, kind and helpful. Special mention to Jay at the door, it was great to meet him!!

Fantastic place with completely excellent service. the young lady at the front desk/counter was amazing, she was highly delightful to converse with especially attractive to look at and very insiteful to question about availability of rooms. ‚Ä¶

The Walker Hotel Tribeca was lovely. The mid century modern vibe is exactly as advertised, and the lobby is impeccable. The cafe and lobby bar are so convenient, as well as the nearby subway hub on canal street. I was surprised to hear the ‚Ä¶
Fantastic hotel - will stay here every time I'm passing through NYC. Staff, decor, views, everything was great. ‚Ä¶

I would avoid if you want a no-worries stay (especially for business).

Pros: Staff are generally kind. ‚Ä¶
Great Staff. Clean Rooms. Great Location. Fantastic rooftop bar and beyond amazing coffee in the lounge area. will definitely be coming back, they care about their clientele!

The concierge / bartender on floor 1 was extremely rude and overbearing for guests of the hotel when trying to have 1 drink at one of the bar options - made 4 of us feel super uncomfortable and we chose to leave
Wow, what can I say about the Walker Tribeca? I had a bit of a transcendent experience but I'll try my best to describe my stay. ‚Ä¶

The service here is amazing: thoughtful and warm. Thanks Fatima‚ù§Ô∏è and the entire staff.
I think it‚Äôs better to go to a higher floor because of the noise. Otherwise? It was fantastic

Nice hotel in a nice location at a reasonable rate but service could be slightly improve. Also kinda weird, and a pain if you have a lot of luggage, is that there are stairs up or down right as you enter - before you have access to an elevator or check in
Friendly staff, cool lounge, and cute rooms!  The location was great for us, just a short walk to the subway or to our new favorite pizza place (Manero's in Little Italy!).

The Walker Hotel was amazing!  While the rooms were charming, nice, well appointed, with marble bathrooms, and great views, etc, etc., it was the HOTEL STAFF that made it truly amazing.  The people that work at the Walker are SINCERE.  As in, they actually give a damn!  And well, that's priceless.  I highly recommend The Walker Hotel.

The customer care person was not helpful and rude.
The hotel room offered was not aligned with the description.
They even gave me trouble when requested to be invoiced.
Terrible - stay way.

Rooms have been updated with the latest electronics while retaining the old world charm. View from the rooftop bar is spectacular. If you can find the speakeasy after roof closes, it will be well worth it.
Excellent amenities, clean, and in a great location. Would highly recommend.
Lovely hotel. Great location and mind-blowing view! Be aware, that the bar is not open every day and there is no breakfast on Monday.
Great location close to lots of subway lines. Rooms are small but has everything you need. Great coffee next door.
i only went to the coffee shop, good place to work but the wifi is really bad. i would only go if u bring ur own hotspot. but a lot of people work in the lobby/coffee shop area!

Love it!  Love the gym design.
Staff super friendly. Eli helped me tons with all my luggage during my checkout. It wasn‚Äôt even his responsibility and he was way too nice to help me! He was my hero.

Brand new hotel located in Tribeca area, just off the Canal Street. Walking distance to Little Italy and SoHo. Very friendly service, reasonable prices. Please note that rooms are on a smaller size - perfect for a weekend getaway but ‚Ä¶
Although the room was quite small, it was perfect for my needs, with a lovely view. The staff was so helpful and accommodating. I would definitely stay again !
The smallest hotel I have ever stayed in.  Awful.  Not advertised as a ‚Äúmicro‚Äù hotel.   Front desk insisted that‚Äôs what it was. Received pushback from asking for extra hangers.
The room is clean, very tight but good design. The Wifi is NOT GOOD in the room! It's very unstable. Everything is smart, but not everything works ‚Äì some lights in my room were not working.

One if the best hotel experience I ever had!
Amazing team, great location with everything around-good food, bars, art galleries and shops. ‚Ä¶

Our stay was excellent! Reservations were quick and simple to book online. From the location, to the amenities, and service teem in place, Walker Hotel Tribeca is a fun and easy way to enjoy the big city in style and comfort!
My new favorite hotel jn downtown NYC. Great for work trips bc the rooms are comfortable and feel homey. Staff is friendly and the new restaurant is fab.
Quite small room, but for a one person it us OK. Great location next to all must seen places in the Soho!

Don‚Äòt go in winter. The window in my room did not close properly and since the bed is directly next to the window it was really cold at night. Also, despite asking several times, I could not get a second blanket.
Pillows are garbage, but I don‚Äôt want to be mean and give a 4 because it‚Äôs a great hotel. Fix your pillows tho.
Located in lower Manhattan, near to a subway station. You can reach all the highlights of NYC real quick. Modern hotel, nice rooms, top Service. Everything was absolutely perfect
It is perfect and everyone is super friendly! I also love the different "play spaces" such as lounge, roof, coffee shop, and speak easy!
Joshua the bellman was very helpful and courteous. Thank you

The Walker Hotel was wonderful, the room was tidy and simple- all I needed with a little extra for convenience. The staff was the best part. They were super accommodating to some random requests and did everything they could to make sure I had a great experience. Thanks y'all!

This doesn't have a bar, Doesn't have a rooftop, doesn't have a restaurant, rooms are beyond Small. They were office Spaces converted into Rooms. The elevator is constantly getting stuck, also the fire alarm panel is forever going off. And Top of that they have bed bugs
This is a beautifully maintained, clean, hip, fun hotel in a great location. The staff is incredibly friendly (just meet Belle). You will love it.

My stay in the Walker Hotel Tribeca was really excellent! I can recomment it for sure! Easy to walk to midtown or visit lower Manhattan. Rooms are very clean. Perfect service and modern interior. Next time I go to NY I will visit again.

The lobby here is the new living room for quick coffee breaks and work meetings. There is a Blue Bottle Coffee off the lobby. Afternoons, the lobby bar has beer, wine, coffee, and fresh baked cookies.
Great location, efficient room layout, awesome rooftop bar, and a Blue Bottle Coffee in the lobby. Really could not have asked for more from my stay.
Came to the flower shop rooftop pop up! Nice views and beautiful decor. Definitely recommend!
Nice clean hotel with accessible location. Friendly staff and Francis at the front desk very nice and helpful every time we asked for anything. We‚Äôll stay again whenever visit NYC.

Do not recommend this place - Rude staff, dirty room

Great location, very small rooms but comfortable. I had a great city view.
Excellent place, classy and small room. Loved the style. Great rooftop views.
Room was adequate, front desk was friendly but unable to charge the correct card (corporate vs personal) despite repeated requests.  The workout room is utterly inadequate.
Nelson was SO friendly. I don‚Äôt normally write reviews but felt like he deserved some recognition.
Excellent lodgings, clean and modern. Friendly staff as well. Rooms were small but you don‚Äôt come to nyc to stay in a hotel room
all 5 of their lobby bathrooms said "out of order" and when I asked for assistance and guidance ...their concierge were unhelpful and unapologetic
Just okay. Rooms too small even for NYC standards. The floors were uneven and the ventilation system wasn't great.

Bluebottle on the ground floor is super.

A good deal in a good location, but the rooms are tiny. Better to visit the lounge, rooftop bar and speakeasy than to actually stay.

Loved the style and decor.  Room wasn‚Äôt anything special though. Small space, but that‚Äôs nyc. Try the speakeasy downstairs. Great location.
Location was great, staff was friendly and knowledgeable, rooms were modern and comfortable. Open bar, rooftop bar, cafe, Needed iron, but was none.
It‚Äôs a beautiful hotel, young and modern, I went to the roof and it‚Äôs an amazing view, the service staff were super friendly, nice cocktails.
Incredibly tasteful and great service and atmosphere. Amazing value for money compared to other NYC hotels. Will return!

Rooms are small but that‚Äôs expected in nyc. Clean, great design, really cool bathroom/shower. Would recommend.

While I cannot speak to the rooms, I did spend some time in the lounge/waiting area and enjoyed a delicious old fashioned. Service was excellent, I‚Äôm looking forward to going back
Nice clean hotel, I would be glad to stay here again. The staff is friendly.
Small room but super comfortable and stylish. Well located next to soho and few subway lines
Tiny room, clean, modern.
Decent hotel, clean and modern. In the heart of TriBeCa. However, as typical in NYC though, the rooms are rather small.
Smallish rooms (which is everywhere in NYC) with cool decoration and theme. Great music. Great coffee in AM.

Great spot. Good location. Rooms are comfortable. Lobby space is nice. Will stay again.
Great value, surprisingly spacious, very cute atmosphere and great location. I was surprised no room service.
Great service from Samantha, Johnny and entire staff. They were quick to find solutions to any issues with professionalism and courtesy.  A rare find in todays service industry.
